result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Steven Rupno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Steven Rupno

records.addlTxt: Judg of Conv; Moved, left no address

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Steven Rupno in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Michael Steven Rupno.  Agreement reached.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Steven Rupno in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Michael Steven Rupno. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.
Arraignment scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not use/possess any illegal substances without valid prescription.

Clerk BMC; Apprs: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Steven Rupno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Michael Steven Rupno. Def consents to appearing by video. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Court sets $300 cash bond. Def waives time limits. Court accepts. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
